item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 132-134, Sussex Gardens, Paddington, London

item.title: Gate down into the River is jammed, 19th June
item.description:
Hi, I'm part of the local friends group (managed by Geoff) and am regularly picking up litter around Glassmill Pond and on the Queensmead rec. To get into the channel through Queensmead rec I have to walk under the culvert at the bottom of Glassmill Lane. Ideally I would have access through the gate closest to the culvert by Martins Lane (this gate is close to the fixed ladder into the channel), however, the gate seems jammed. Please can this be looked into. Geoff has a key to the padlock which opens ok. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At the bus stop M, 19th June
item.description:
Peckham hill street at the bus stop M The floor is black from the old dry oil ! It’s been like this for ages, it need to be jet washed with a hot water and strong chemical product to remove this residue! The floor around this litter bin looks so horrible and unhygienic! Please assist

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Peckham Hill Street, Peckham, London

item.title: Numerous reports no result, 19th June
item.description:
I honestly think it’s been nearly 2 years since I first submitted a report I’ve submitted subsequent reports since but still nothing has changed The park is a shambles The floor is extremely dangerous since it is falling apart The equipment is also falling apart The metal spring that was left in the floor is still there!!! So just to confirm there is literally a piece of metal sticking out the floor for anyone to impale theirselves on when they fall over When is the park going to be refurbished?? Why has the spring not been removed from the floor? Why has the floor not been repaired or a new floor laid? It’s beyond a joke now and we all pay our council tax each month so why can’t we have a safe space for our children to play in? It’s a dangerous park and shouldn’t be open if nothing is going to be fixed or replaced or dangerous metal springs removed from the floor!!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Cray Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Obstruction - Overgrown / overhanging private tree / hedge

item.title: At the road junction of Eton Road and Haverstock Hill, 19th June
item.description:
At present the roadworks are ongoing, however... for weeks now there is still no clear demarcation or segregation between the pedestrians footpath and the path for traffic. There are no 'safe' crossing 'start' and 'end' points for pedestrians crossing Eton road on Haverstock Hill. The junction is now fully paved with blockwork - the roadway is blended into footpath. There is no kerb-line at the junction, no restrictive bollards, no barriers, no line-marking, nor tactile paving for pedestrians. (The Current bollards are set far back from the junction and are not visible in low light)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eton Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
